content: I’m not familiar with Kanban, but I’m familiar with failed organisational change; and some, although fewer, successful organisational change efforts. In my exp tools can be used to open dialogue, and that it’s dialogue that creates change not tools/instruments — unless you have the view that the consultant/change agent is the instrument of change. Many leaders espouse change, organisational improvement efforts, they do not necessarily assume that they have to be an intimate part of it. If you see organisations as living systems, then the work (creating the conditions) is with the system….the memories, the patterns, the anchors.
